fields.summary: Children Display Macro Error changes languages randomly on page reload

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The uploader from [File List|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/file-list-blueprint-937893647.html] doesn't respect Attachment Maximum Size.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the Attachment Maximum Size to less than 1MB
**  !Screenshot 2018-06-05 14.16.26.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a page from File List blueprint
# Upload the file which size is more than 1MB from the uploader in the page
** !Screenshot 2018-06-05 14.17.07.png|thumbnail!   
# Check the upload successfully completed

h3. Expected Results

The file exceeding Attachment Maximum Size should be rejected in any user-facing form on Confluence.

h3. Actual Results

User can upload file exceeding Attachment Maximum Size.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: User can upload file exceeding attachment maximum size in File List page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When opening a link that leads to an anchor, if the anchor is placed anywhere below a third party macro (as the edraw.io), the page will move after it loads.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Draw.io add-on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with some contents, a draw.io diagram and an anchor below the diagram
# Copy the link to this anchor
# Open this link

h3. Expected Results
The page should open on the anchor and stay on it

h3. Actual Results
The page will open correctly on the anchor but, as soon as the draw.io macro loads, the page moves.
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround so far.
fields.summary: Anchor moves after third party macro loads

fields.description:
Implement gamification for Confluence, be it by badges, karmas, or any other type of score of points. 

At this moment, there is no add-on that implements this on Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Gamification for Confluence: Badge, Karma or any score points
Project Picker Custom Field of Jira is not displaying properly in Confluence, through Jira Issue macro
Checkbox Custom Field of Jira is not displaying properly in Confluence, through Jira Issue macro

fields.description:
When using '!' to insert a file or image, there is no wildcard support on the file suggestion search. This means that large data sets have to be reversed:
e.g.
Logical Hierarchy:
container_category_filename.png
Optimal Suggestion Search:
filename_category_container.png

In addition to that, the wildcard search for Open File Library > Search on Other Pages is not very robust and always produces incomplete results.
1. Create a group (10) of files in a file repository on a space
2. Name them container_category_filename01.png 02,03 etc
3. Type '!'
4. Open Search
5. Type category or filename
6. Observe that some but not all images appear
7. The optimal search with wildcard here would be r_c or y_f. Neither of which is possible.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence Search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The integration between Confluence Questions and HipChat was deprecated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back the option to send notifications to a HipChat room when a Question is asked on Confluence.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Bring back the Confluence Questions and HipChat integration

fields.description:
As Space Attachments macro is going to be [deprecated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html?_ga=2.143202549.1939820020.1527508702-474844642.1525897288], and it's not possible adding labels to attachments at this moment (CONFCLOUD-57202) to use together with the [Content by Label macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html], this suggestion is for either:
- *do not deprecate the Space Attachments macro* 
or 
- a *substitute macro* that serves the same purpose.
fields.summary: Space Attachments macro substitute

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The documentation [Use Hipchat and Confluence together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-hipchat-and-confluence-together-724765441.html] is listing Confluence Questions notifications option (Question I asked), which is not available anymore according to the [Recent changes to Questions for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questionscloud/recent-changes-to-questions-for-confluence-931038974.html]. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the documentation [Use Hipchat and Confluence together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-hipchat-and-confluence-together-724765441.html]

h3. Expected Results
The image [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/files/724765441/724765448/2/1498527612657/SpaceToRoomSetupPrivate.png] displays the options currently available.

h3. Actual Results
The image shows the "Question I asked", which is not available anymore.
fields.summary: Use Hipchat and Confluence together - documentation is outdated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anonymous users can't access public pages and spaces, a blank white screen is shown

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow anonymous access to Confluence on Global permissions
# Allow anonymous access to at least one space
# Try to access the instance using incognito mode or logged out.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to access those public pages

h3. Actual Results
A blank white page is shown
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Not known at the  moment
fields.summary: Anonymous users can't access Confuence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not being able to create new pages nor edit pages in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Go to a Confluence instance;
# Click on the *+* icon to create a new *blank page*;

h3. Expected Results 
* The editor opens for the user to insert content in it.

h3. Actual Results 
* The loading page keeps spinning and refreshing, without rendering the editor.

h3. Notes 
* The following information can be seen on the console:

{code}
GET https://have-i-seen-it.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/flags?userKey=1a6b187c-66ae-4115-9281-4aac023c548f%2B557058%3Ad89e16a5-ef82-4f3f-b845-7d721774687a 400 (Bad Request)
{code}

h3.Workaround 
* Clean the browser's cache
fields.summary: Not able to create nor edit pages in Confluence

fields.description:
When I upload multiple versions of a document, the options to edit the file will move further and further down under the earliest version.

In case there are a lot of file versions this means scrolling down a lot. My suggestion is to move the "edit file" option above the file versions so that scrolling down is not necessary any more.
fields.summary: Move "Edit file" option above the file versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
I am trying to develop a Confluence Cloud app, based on ACE + Node.js. One requirement of this app is that I need to authenticate a user by showing a dialog and requesting user mail and password. This user does not need to be the current user in web session.

h3. Notes
The use case is simple. We write documents in our instance that need to be signed, and for that purpose, we need to re-authenticate the user at the time they are signing as if it was an electronic signature. It's a must for us to re-authenticate the user.
fields.summary: Re-authenticate user from a cloud app

fields.description: In the "Content by Label" macro, We would like to have an option for sorting by page-tree order (the order that pages show up in the hierarchy). This would have the double advantage of allowing users to control how these pages are actually sorted as well as providing a consistent look across macros that provide sorting of pages.
fields.summary: Add Sorting to match page tree order in Macro Sorting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an add-on is removed, all pages containing any macro from that add-on will still display it (as it's the case with Team Calendars) or show an "unknown macro" warning.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a feature to remove a macro from all pages.


h3. Workaround
Manually remove the macro from the pages.
fields.summary: Ability to remove a macro from multiple pages

fields.description:
The current message displayed when the site-admin is deleting a user describes the old behavior of the database. 
It says that if you create a new user with the same username, it'll be associated with the deleted user, but that's not happening anymore since the contributions are linked with the user-key and not to the username.

!Message.png!
fields.summary: Update message when deleting a user

fields.description:
When [linking Confluence with Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html] and allowing *Any Active User* to see the space, it will provide access for customers that do not have a license in Confluence.

By allowing access to the pages, if using a Jira macro (or any macro to retrieve Jira content), if the same is restricted to other users, not including the customers in question (e.g. *everyone*/non-logged users), the macro will display a message that the *JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.*. 

This is a suggestion to allow customers from open spaces to access the Jira issues tickets in Confluence side, independent of the restrictions from Jira.

Note: This also applies to a Service Desk customer who has a license in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow Customers/Non-Licensed Users to See Tickets/Macros in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
This issue is now solved for Cloud to Cloud migrations.

We are currently working on a long term solution for Server to Cloud migrations but this will still take some time, and is tracked here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-64436
{panel}
h3. Summary

Unknown Users after Migrating from another Confluence instance
h3. Description

After migrating space by space from another Confluence instance, there might be users listed as *Unknown Users*

!screenshot-1.png!
h3. Workaround

Contact [Atlassian Support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Unknown Users after Migrating
Please add time to the comments, Date of posting presentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

No email notification being received from Team Calendars when make own changes in Team Calendar even thought *Notify on my actions* has configured in Email settings. 

h3. Environment
Chrome, FireFox, Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create User A and User B and make sure both watching the calendar
# User A - Drang and drop the event in a Team Calendar (eg, drag the event from 30th to 31st)
 # User B - Received the email notification 
 # User A - Does not receive email notification about the changes he made

h3. Expected Results
 * As  *Notify on my actions* is enable in the email settings, User A should be able to receive an email notification about the changes he made.

h3. Actual Results
 * User A is not receiving any Team Calendar notification.

h3. Actual Results
 * Other Confluence notification (eg, edit page, add page) is working but not for Team Calendar
fields.summary: No email notification from Team calendar when making own changes on the Calendar

fields.description:
Currently there is *no clear way to identify individual attachments files* from a Jira backup zip file, rendering them difficult to make use of for attachment archiving/backup purposes.  

As part of the backup zip, attachments are currently placed in a directory with the same name as the project key (*Data* → *Attachments* → _*+Project key+*_ → _*+Issue Key+*_ ). There you will find any issue attachments with numerical names (i.e. 17804) but *no file extension*.
 # If you choose to open an attachment file with a web browser and the file contains a picture, the browser will successfully open it. You can then afterwards rename the file and add the extension.
 # _However_, if the attachment file does not happen to be an image then users need to manually identify each file somehow and add the correct extension. 

To do this, you would currently need to visit the issue within the Jira site that generated the backup to identify what extension is needed. If you have access to do this however then it's obviously easier to just download the attachment from the issue directly. 

This renders downloading the backup zip for attachment archiving/backup purposes mostly redundant at the moment.
fields.summary: Export attachments with filenames

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 - Using custom export for XML will export all the content and attachments of the space rather than the selected pages only.
 - This would impact those who have large spaces as it downloads the entire space rather than only the selected pages
 - The size of the file downloaded is the same whether we select one page or export all the space.
 - The content of the extracted zip file is the same whether we select one page or export all the space

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) In space settings, click on Content tools
2) Click on export
3) Click on XML and next
4) Click on Custom export and select on one or two pages but not all pages.
5) Click on export

As based on the documentation : [Export Content to Word, PDF, HTML and XML - Notes on XML exporting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-724764824.html#ExportContenttoWord,PDF,HTMLandXML-NotesonXMLexporting]
h3. Expected Results

It should only export the relevant content of the selected pages and not all
h3. Actual Results

Exported all the content and media attachments related to the space
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Custom export for XML exports all the pages in the space though only 1 page is selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Add a Slack macro connector (or linking) for Confluence that generates an automatic Slack notification when a blog post or a page is posted (similar to the integration with HipChat).
h3. Notes

At this moment, there are add-ons at the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=confluence&query=slack] that send Confluence related notifications to Slack.

The idea would be having this functionality natively on Confluence.
fields.summary: Slack macro connector for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As an app I would like to be able to interface with Confluence's inline commenting API through my macros much the way that one can presently do with images. I envision something where a javascript API would allow my macro to post a comment, and receive an id to the comment that I can use to display it.

h3. Notes
Comments can be created via [Create content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-post] but the ability to make it inline comments is not yet there.
fields.summary: Inline Comment API for Apps

fields.description:
*Summary*

If Jira Cloud instance name contains double dashes  (--), it breaks Jira Macro issue linking between Jira and Confluence.

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
 1. In a Confluence page add a Jira Macro issue from a Jira instance which hostname contains double dashes. E.g [https://abcd--test.atlassian.net|https://abcd--test.atlassian.net/]
 2. Hit Publish
 3. Error will display
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-28 at 11.10.37 AM.png|width=758,height=79!
 *Expected Results*

Issue key to to be displayed along with the summary. No errors to be displayed

*Actual Results*

'java.io.IOException' error 

*Workaround*
1. Migrate to a new Jira site with a URL which does not contain double dashes
OR
2. Do not use Jira macro, insert Web link instead
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro cannot retrieve issues from an instance whose hostname contains double dashes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The user seeing broken text layout on overview page after creating a new space.


h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a new space
# Go to the overview page


h3. Observed behaviour
 !Observed.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected behaviour
 !Expected.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Text layout is broken on overview page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Allow partial match when searching for spaces using space or space.key fields

Otherwise, we need to fetch all spaces from the paginated REST API and filter them in the frontend code.

h3. Expected Results
E.g. a request with a query of "ex" would return a list of spaces like 
{code}
...
{"key": "external", "name": "external content"}, 
{"key":"example", "name":"example space"}, 
{"key":"xyz", "name":"extra space"}
...
{code}

h3.Note
Although using contains operator with the space field is not supported based on [the documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/advanced-searching-using-cql/#contains], for some instances it does work.
{code}
/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=space ~ "ex*" AND type = space
{code}
 !contains_op_in_space_field.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow contains operator ~ for space and space.key fields in the Search REST API to allow partial match

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Confluence search, if trying to search for characters matching exactly a page title, the same will not be displayed as a first result, besides of when it has been updated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to have a page with a specific title (In this example, let's use "*Root Page*" as a title)
# Make sure that the same page title is displayed on different pages, so we can have additional results.
# Save the pages and make sure to search for the page title in Confluence's advanced search.

h3. Expected Results
The page with the title matching with the search should be displayed in the first position.

h3. Actual Results
Pages with the page's title as text in the body will be displayed first.
 
h3. Notes
Some examples of the experience are in the screenshots below. Also, trying with different search filters presenting different results:

*Bug's behavior. Notice that the page with the title matching the search is displayed in the bottom, instead of the top:*
!titleonly.png|thumbnail!

*If the text is displayed in both the title and page's body:*
!titlepage.png|thumbnail!

*If searching for words in the title. Not the full page title text:*
!singleword.png|thumbnail!

*If searching for the exact page title between quotes. The page is displayed as a first result:*
!titlequote.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Search for the page title using quotes.
fields.summary: [Backend] Confluence Search Results Are Not Accurate for Page Titles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the mobile app, when you select a specific space, and then run a search, the results show from all spaces.

One would assume that since you've navigated to a specific space, the results should limit themselves to that space by default.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ensure that the search results that come up first should be restricted to a specific space if you have selected it.

If the user has run a search from the main screen of the app, then it should show all results.

On the search results that are limited to a space, we could write a message saying "search results are limited to space (space name here). Click here for full results"
fields.summary: Search within a space on mobile app is not limited to that space

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user has multiple options to [edit the table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-formatting-to-your-page-724764836.html#Addformattingtoyourpage-Edityourtable] and make it look to fit better with the page's design. 

However, in cases where the same needs to use a table without gridlines, there is no option to hide it. This is a suggestion to provide the user an ability to create tables without gridlines and another kind of lines/borders.
fields.summary: Ability to Hide Table lines/borders/gridlines for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding the Style Macro to a page causes the content to become look like it's right indented when rendered.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
Create an empty Confluence page
* Add style macro to the page
* Add some other content so we can see the indentation
* Save
* View page and you'll see that you text is indented.
* Remove the style macro from the page and compare the difference.

h3. Expected results:
 !2018-05-24_11-50-33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results:
 !2018-05-24_11-49-55.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Page content is right-indented if Style Macro is added on a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever a user is deleted and recreated later, the space name is not updated again to reflect the user and shows Unknown User (User Key) instead

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a personal space and a few pages within the space
# Delete the user account that created the space and pages
# Recreate user with same e-mail address
# View personal space again

h3. Expected Results

Personal space title shows full name
No 'Unknown User' showing

h3. Actual Results

Personal space title shows (Unknown User)
Pages do show the user's name properly though


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: [Backend] Unknown User (User Key) on Confluence personal space after deleting/recreating user account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are creating Web Linked Images in Confluence where the images are hosted in Bitbucket repositories however when the Confluence Page is exported (to PDF for example), no image is returned

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option that keeps the User's Session to Bitbucket during the PDF Export process so that the Images in the External Locations are exported

h3. Why this is important
Customer would not like to keep images synced/updated in multiple locations
 
h3. Workaround 
Embed the image in the Confluence Page rather than in Bitbucket or host the image in a Publicly Accessible location
fields.summary: Export Images Linked to Bitbucket Repos

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the [Google Drive macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview], if the logged user is not the author/owner of the document, a message to "authenticate/Sign in as the user" will be displayed, with a *SIgn in to Google* button. Due to [not having options to see the document directly in Confluence|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53356], the user will need to authenticate.

Recently, if the user clicks on this button, the following message will be displayed:

*Sign in with Google temporarily disabled for this app - This app has not been verified yet by Google in order to use Google Sign In.*

!google.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to install the *Google Drive Macro* for Confluence
 # After that, when *editing* a page, insert a *Google Sheets* with a valid URL for a spreadsheet in the user's drive.
# Once added to the page, click on *Publish* to save the changes
# Observe the message and click on *Sign in to Google* 

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to authenticate and see the document, based on Google's permission.

h3. Actual Results
The message that this feature is disabled is displayed, avoiding the document to be displayed.

h3. Workaround
The is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Google Drive Macro/Add-on Not Allowing Users to Sign In to See the Content

fields.description:
We are using Jira Issue Macro to populate a Confluence document but we would like to update the Jira Table content only when the Confluence Page is Published. This due to the fact that we use Confluence for ISO Quality Management. Actually this could apply to all the macros.

The alternative solution is the possibility to have a Static Copy of a Page

For the moment we can use the Jira Static Blueprint

Thanks and

Best Regards
fields.summary: Freeze Jira Issue Macro Output

fields.description:
When highlighting text in Confluence, the user will be able to create a Jira issue directly on Jira from it. The highlighted text will be used as a summary/description of it. However, in specific cases (I.E. using bullet points) if we highlight the whole topic, the formatting will not be kept. 

Instead of using the original formatting, Jira will put it all as text, not respecting line breaks. This is a suggestion to keep the same/improve the formatting for the Jira macro when being created directly from Confluence's highlight feature.
fields.summary: Keep Formatting When Creating Jira Issues from Confluence's Highlight Feature

fields.description:
In Confluence, when pasting Jira tickets URLs directly into the editor/comment section, the same will be automatically converted into a [Jira Issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html]. However, if the user copy/paste a Service Desk ticket URL (which will be different from the original, directly from Jira), the same will not be converted/or be able to be retrieved through a Jira macro. 

This is a suggestion to allow the URLs from Service Desk to be automatically converted as well.
fields.summary: Convert Customer Portal URL for Ticket

fields.description:
The gallery macro will be removed as announced in: [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]

The page suggests that people insert images directly as an alternative, but as per customers feedback, this is in no way an alternative as this macro is used to display dynamic pages of images from a library based on labels. 

This is a macro that is not obsolete, it's one that needs fixing so it works as it used to (i.e. you could click on the image to download it) known issue reported in the CONFCLOUD-57288-Gallery macro with style macro makes the preview on gallery macro is not working.
fields.summary: Gallery macro removal feedback

fields.description:
*Summary*

* We have seen an unusual behavior with the page tree, when the homepage is not defined for a particular space, normally page tree shouldn’t be loaded but for a couple of users, but we saw that the page tree loaded with pages from other spaces, once the home page is set for the particular space, the page tree for the current space is loaded. It is not reproducible in our test instance. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a space
* Add pages
* No Homepage Defined

*Expected Results*
* Page tree shouldn't be loaded in the sidebar

*Actual Results*
* Page tree loaded with pages from other spaces.

*Workaround*
* Add a homepage to the current space, so that the page tree will be loaded with pages from the current space.
fields.summary: Page Tree loaded with pages from other Spaces

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to select a table within a macro for e.g. TIP macro, using the mouse, it is only possible by double-clicking on the edge of the table as shown in the video attached.

The user would like to select the entire table using the mouse inside a macro, as we copy the table normally.
fields.summary: Enable Selecting a table inside a Macro using Mouse

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workbox on Confluence is showing an empty box when accessing from Firefox.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Firebox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Confluence using Firefox
# Click on *Bell* icon (Notifications) from the sidebar

h3. Expected Results
Recent activities are showing

h3. Actual Results
A blank page is showing.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

*Application logs:*
* No error in Developer Tools

h3. Notes
* The issue doesn't happen on Chrome
* The issue only happens when opening Workbox for the *First Time*

h3.Workaround
Close the workbox, then open it again.
fields.summary: Workbox Shows Blank on Firefox
Comments editor not showing

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
* By navigating through pages in a space, even though you have access to comment on that page, the comment's box is not available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Navigate to a page
# Wait for it to load fully

h3. Expected Results 
* You can see the comment's box on the bottom of the page.

h3. Actual Results 
* There is no comment's box on the bottom of the page, as per the screenshot below:

!Screen Shot 2018-05-21 at 17.49.21.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround 
* Use inline comments.
fields.summary: Comment's box missing from Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, depending on the kind of image that is attached, due to its size and resolution Confluence takes a long time to download and display it, whether it is in Editor Preview mode. 

h3. The Suggestion
Either improve the speed in which Confluence renders those files, or provide a conversion of those files when they are uploaded.
fields.summary: Increase performance of image preview in Confluence
There is no API to resolve page ID from page URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user has organized their Confluence page using Page Tree Macros, they will not display on the mobile view. Instead, a blank space is displayed.

h3. Environment

* Mobile Web

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 page (Page A and Page B)
# Add page tree on the space homepage
# Visit the homepage on a Mobile browser (Mobile view)

h3. Expected Results
Page tree should display on the space homepage in mobile browser

h3. Actual Results
Page tree is blank space and does not display

h3. Workaround

* View it in Desktop version instead of mobile view
fields.summary: Mobile View does not display page tree macros

fields.description:
h3. Description
Youtube has an option to mark where you want the video to start. However, Widget Connector plugin isn't respecting this parameter.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page and add widget connector plugin.
# Add the following Youtube link:
{code}
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=whp2Y_MjTXs&feature=youtu.be&t=93
{code}
# Save and you'll be presented the video starting from the start.

h3. Expected Result
The video starts from exactly the specified time

h3. Actual results
The Video starts from random point within 2 minutes of the specified time

h3. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Widget Connector plugin should respect specified youtube start time.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence cloud users should be able to integrate an external data source. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable users to connect external databases

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Integrate external database with Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While editing the File List Blueprint, it shows an error in preview mode.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the File List Blueprint
# Hit Preview


h3. Expected Results
It`ll show the Blueprint preview

h3. Actual Results
It shows the following error while rendering the Page
{noformat}
"Error rendering macro 'attachments' : Could not check permissions for page: Template Preview v.1 (0) no suitable delegate found."{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
When the page is published, it renders correctly.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: File List blueprint shows error on preview mode

fields.description:
As documented in the notice to Confluence Cloud API developers regarding upcoming changes to protect user privacy, we are introducing significant changes to Confluence Cloud REST APIs to remove private user information.

At a high level, these changes will include changes to the shape of {{user}} objects in the Confluence Cloud REST APIs and the replacement of {{userKey}} and {{username}} parameters with {{accountId}}.

*Follow this ticket for specific information about changes and applicable dates to Confluence context parameters in Atlassian Connect framework*
fields.summary: Privacy changes to Confluence context parameters in Atlassian Connect framework

fields.description:
As documented in the notice to Confluence Cloud API developers regarding upcoming changes to protect user privacy, we are introducing significant changes to Confluence Cloud REST APIs to remove private user information.

*Fields that accept email as part of the cql query will only match a user where the email address is visible for that users privacy settings. This ticket tracks this change.*
fields.summary: Privacy changes for CQL user fields

fields.description:
As documented in the notice to Confluence Cloud API developers regarding upcoming changes to protect user privacy, we are introducing significant changes to Confluence Cloud REST APIs to remove private user information.

*This ticket tracks the removal of {{username}} values in all Confluence Cloud REST APIs.* They will be replaced with {{accountId}}.
fields.summary: Privacy changes to Confluence username values in REST API endpoints

fields.description:
As documented in the notice to Confluence Cloud API developers regarding upcoming changes to protect user privacy, we are introducing significant changes to Confluence Cloud REST APIs to remove private user information.

*This ticket tracks changes to the shape of {{user}} objects in all Confluence Cloud REST APIs.*

When a user object is returned in a Confluence API today, it includes a number of attributes about a user. These user objects will change substantially following the deprecation period.
fields.summary: Privacy changes to Confluence user object in REST API endpoints

fields.description:
Summary

When Jira macro is added to the blog, the Jira macro issue is unreadable.

Steps to Reproduce

# Create a blogs and Jira issue
# Add a Jira issue filter macro in the page
# Published and found out the layout seem to be broken

Expected Results

Jira issue filter should display nicely on the blog.

Actual Results

The layout of the blog is deformed

Workaround

No workaround for the time being.
fields.summary: Blogpost layout deformed when adding Jira filter macro

When a user goes to *Space Settings* the sidebar is disappearing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when you search an item in Confluence, it shows you the search results, but then clicking on the result only takes you to the page itself and doesn't show you where on the page the result is.

h3. Suggested Solution
This could be remedied with CONFCLOUD-6174 but also an idea is to jump to the exact result on the page.
fields.summary: Ability to jump to exact line referenced in search results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Report Login & Approve button is not working

h3. Description
When creating a non-default/system application link to/from a Confluence or Jira that is not under the same URL, the *Jira Report* page template shows a message like the one below:

{quote}
You are viewing this selected server as anonymous. You may want to Login & Approve.
{quote}

Clicking the *Login & Approve* does nothing. This way, the user is not able to create a template using the *Simple* option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an Application Link between a *Confluence Cloud* site and a *Jira Cloud* site with different URLs. Example: {{foo1.atlassian.net}} and {{foo2.atlassian.net/wiki}}
# Once the links are configured, go to the Confluence site and *Create* a New page, selecting the *Jira Report* as a template.
# Select one of the report types, then click *Next*.
# You'll see the following message: "You are viewing this selected server as anonymous. You may want to Login & Approve." 
# Click the *Login & Approve*

h3. Expected Results

You are redirected to Authenticate to Jira.

h3. Actual Results 

You are not redirected and you can't create a Jira Report because the *Project* field is required - and you can't pick one because it doesn't display anything.

h3. Workaround 

# Go to *+* 
# Select *Jira Report*
# Pick one of the templates, the "You are viewing this selected server as anonymous. You may want to Login & Approve." will be displayed. 
# Ignore it and pick the *Switch to Advanced*
# Insert a valid JQL (e.g.: {{project != empty}}
# Click *Create*
# The editor will show up. *Publish* the page.
# The Jira macros will display an *Authenticate* option. Click it.
# This will redirect the user to make the authentication in the Jira instance - even though he/she is already logged in.
# After that, any further attempts by this user will be valid and the *Jira Report* template will work as expected.
fields.summary: Jira Report Login & Approve button is not working

fields.description:
h3. The issue
The editor is not working within the Confluence Editor. Once you hit "Submit", there is a spinning wheel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Confluence Page
# On the top-right corner of the Editor's toolbar, click on *Feedback*
# Insert your comment and hit *Submit*

h3. Expected Behavior
The feedback will be sent to the proper team.

h3. Actual Behavior
Infinite spinning wheel.
fields.summary: Editor Feedback Button is Not Working

fields.description:
If a user does not have Confluence application access and they try to access pages that are publicly/anonymously visible they will not be allowed to see it until they log out of OnDemand.

Steps to reproduce:

create a new user
give them access to JIRA only
Create a new Space on Confluence that has anonymous access
log in as the new user and try to access the page
Result: You are blocked from seeing Confluence.
fields.summary: Users without Confluence application access cannot see Confluence pages with anonymous access

fields.description:
Actually, it seems like any *.action title causes this to happen.

See here for examples:
 * [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SHPXLII8/pages/655065451/movepage.action]
 * [https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/BA/pages/3394143225/movepage.action]

I don't think it's a backend routing issue - I chucked a breakpoint in ConfluenceServletDispatcher and it never got triggered.
fields.summary: Naming a page movepage.action causes it to never load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Confluence Cloud space exporter is leaving *notification* data in space exports which cause problems in Confluence Server once those spaces are imported. 

This prevents Confluence server from being able to manipulate content in certain ways after the space is imported. So far, we have seen this prevent admins from deleting the space, as well as preventing admins from enabling Collaborative Editing in Server.

While there are workaround for Confluence Server, we should fix the root of the issue in Cloud to prevent the problem from occurring. The data in the space export should not contain the notifications which induce this behavior.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud > Space Exported > Imported to Confluence Server

h3. How to Replicate
# Export a space from Confluence Cloud
# Import it to Confluence Server
# Attempt to either:
#* Enable Collaborative Editing: CONFSERVER-55576
#* Delete the imported space: CONFSERVER-52755

h3. Symoptoms
Either of the following in the atlassian-confluence.log files on Server:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fk_notifications_content" on table "notifications"
  Detail: Key (contentid)=(4423910) is still referenced from table "notifications".
{code}
{code:borderStyle=solid}
could not execute statement; SQL [n/a]; constraint [fk_notifications_content]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not execute statement; SQL [n/a]; constraint [fk_notifications_content]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement at 
{code}

h3. Workarounds
Workarounds for the Server end are detailed in their respective tickets:
* Enable Collaborative Editing: CONFSERVER-55576
* Delete the imported space: CONFSERVER-52755
fields.summary: Space exporter does not groom notifications properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
* If you try to @ mention a user by going to *Insert more content > User mention*, you won't be able to type anything on the editor to search a user's name to mention.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Edit a Confluence page;
# On the top bar of Confluence's editor, click on *Insert more content*;
# Click on the option *User mention*;
# The @ symbol shows on the editor.

h3. Expected Results 
* You start typing a user's name to @ mention and this user is displayed on the search, as in a regular @ mention function.

h3. Actual Results 
* If you start typing a user's name to @ mention, no character is shown on the editor;
* If you click on the editor to type a user's name to @ mention, the @ symbol is lost its formatting of mention.

h3.Workaround 
* Use the @ mention by typing directly on the editor the *@* symbol.
fields.summary: @ mention of Insert other macros menu is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you wanted to watch a Jira card/issue that is added to a Confluence page. You would need to access the issue in Jira and watch it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to watch a Jira card/issue from Confluence without going into Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to watch Jira card/issue from Confluence
Select all/deselect all checkbox of Jira Issue macro is not working

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Table with large images not rendering correctly when published. Table renders correctly in edit mode.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a blog post
 # Create a table and add large images to it
 # Hit publish

h3. *Expected Results*

The table should render correctly
h3. *Actual Results*

Table not rendering images correctly when the blog is published. It works fine in edit mode.
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-17 at 1.12.25 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-05-17 at 1.13.03 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Table with images not rendering correctly in Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the user types a Label shortcut on a space, the cursor focus must be set by the mouse click. It's not set automatically as used to be.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter in a space
 # type the "l" shortcut
 # try to type the Label

h3. Expected Results

The cursor focus should go automatically to the Label box
h3. Actual Results

The cursor doesn't appear in the Label Box
h3. Workaround

Use the mouse to start to type in the box

h3. Work to be done
Please fix this to work for all label dialogs (page labels, attachment labels)
fields.summary: Space Label's shortcuts not set the cursor focus automatic to the box

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the space has no overview (home page) page, the sidebar page tree will load forever and not display the pages

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a space with lots of pages;
# Delete the space home page

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar page tree should display the remaining pages

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar page tree loads forever and doesn't display the pages.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
# Create a new page
# Access the space and click on *Space settings* on the sidebar;
# Click on *Edit space settings*;
# Type the new page's name at the *Home page* field, select the page and hit *Save*;
# At the same screen, select the *Content Tools* tab and then *Reorder Pages*;
# Drag and drop all pages to be under the new home page.
fields.summary: Infinite spinner for the sidebar page tree

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating on the page tree for an instance with the new look, clicking on a page make the pages / page tree disappear.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create pages in order to have a page tree a few levels deep.
 * Set a page as home page/overview on the Space settings > Overview > Space Details > Home page > add name of the page, EXAMPLE_PAGE > Save.
 * Reorder the pages in a way that the EXAMPLE_PAGE is not on the first level of the page tree: Space settings > Content Tools > Reorder Pages > move the EXAMPLE_PAGE from the first level to another level.
 * Navigate through the page tree levels.

h3. Expected Results
 * The page tree levels are accessible by clicking.

h3. Actual Results
 * The page tree disappears.
 * If you reload the page, the page tree reappears.
 * This behaviour happens if you click on any of the pages.

h3. Workaround
 * Reorder the home page/overview page to be on the first level of the page tree: Space settings > Content Tools > Reorder Pages > move the EXAMPLE_PAGE to the first level.
 *OR*
 * Choose a page on the first level of the page tree to be the home page/overview page: Space settings > Overview > Space Details > Home page > add name of a page on the first level of the page tree > Save.
fields.summary: Pages and page tree disappear when clicking on a page on the page tree

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you add a Contributors macro and choose to show *Last Contribution Time*, the time shown is incorrect. It would show *17667 days ago* which is incorrect. Please note that the behavior is intermittent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a contributors macro to a page
# Use the Parameters below
{noformat}
Contributors Type: Watches
Select (Show Count?, Show Last Contribution Time)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
It should show the correct last time each person made a contribution of Watches

h3. Actual Results
It is showing an incorrect *Last Contribution Time*
fields.summary: Contributors macro does not work properly

fields.description:
Summary
When opening around 10 tabs in the browser and bulk updating them the "Unpublished changes" shown even the content is already up to date. 

Environment
Confluence Cloud
Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open 10 tabs in the browser
* Open the 10 pages in editing mode, insert some text and select the publish button
* Go back to "Recently worked" and noticed some of the pages contain the message

Expected Results
No "Unpublished changes" should be shown

Actual Results
The page is saved and an the message is displayed: "Unpublished changes" at some of the pages

Testing as below:

 [^Testing case 1.mp4]
fields.summary: Bulk updating pages show "Unpublish changes"

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field Number Field
 # Create sample issue with large number value filled. Ex: 200,000,000
 # Create Sample Confluence page
 # Insert JIRA Issue/Filter
 # Search with JQL for sample JIRA issue created
 # Under Display Options > Table > add new custom field number created
 # Insert

h3. Expected Results
 * Formatting between Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud should match

h3. Actual Results
 * Number formatting is different in the Jira issue Macro in Confluence Cloud

In Jira:
{code:java}
200,000,000
{code}
!JIRA.png|thumbnail!

In Confluence:
{code:java}
2.0E8
{code}
h3. !Confluence.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Numbers under 9,999,999 will not switch to scientific notation
 * No other workaround to display values format in Confluence Cloud
fields.summary: Jira Marco Number Formatting does not match Jira Cloud
TEST

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Similar to the [Roadmap Planner macro nested in Excerpt Include macro does not render in Mobile App|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58870], the app should be able to manage the macros without open the content on the mobile browser. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Manage the macro without using the mobile browser

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: "Create from template" macro should works natively on APP

fields.description:
The KB [How to get project id from the Jira User Interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-get-project-id-from-the-jira-user-interface-827341414.html] needs to be updated.

It is possible to see the id by directly accessing (including Jira Cloud) [http://yourjira.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa], then putting the cursor over the *Edit* button.

Besides, the path is still using the old UI as reference.
fields.summary: How to get project id from the Jira User Interface KB
test it out

fields.summary: Remove the double scroll bar appearing for the page tree section in space nav bar

fields.description: As a Space Administrator I would like to be able to copy the *Share a Link* page template and then, be able to change the fields displayed in the pop-up.
fields.summary: Allow users to copy the Share a Link template and change the fields in the copy

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an image is inserted into a table and resized, it won't be exported with the page content to PDF.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table inside a page or a custom template in Confluence;
# Insert an image on the table;
# Resize the image using the image using the option below:                                        
   !resize.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the page and export it to PDF;

 
h3. Expected Results
 * The page is exported and the image inside the table displays as expected.

h3. Actual
 * The page is exported and the image inside is not exported with the page content.

h3. Workaround
* Set the image size to *original*.
fields.summary: Embedded images inside tables are not exported to PDF if the image was resized

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
* When writing a document where you need to type dates, the _Date Picker_ macro will pop up after you finish typing it, getting in the way of your work.

h3. Suggested Solution  
* Offer an option to disable the _Date Picker_ macro on the UI.

h3. Why this is important   
* This feature will enable users to work more smoothly on their documents, as well as it provides an option for the user to choose whether or not to use this macro.

h3. Workaround 
* When typing a date in a document and the _Date Picker_ macro shows up, type either the *Esc* or *Tab* key to dismiss it.
fields.summary: Option to disable the Date Picker macro

fields.description: ih3. Summary When using the '&' symbol in the Code Block macro, the wrong formatting is shown for ampersand. h3. Environment * Confluence Cloud * Any browser h3. Steps to Reproduce * Confluence page on edit mode. * Add the Code Block macro (\{Code Block} or + icon > Other macros > Code Block). * Add code such as this example containing an ampersand on the Code Block macro box: {code:java} sometext {code} * Publish the page. h3. Expected Results * The code is shown correctly. h3. Actual Results * The code appears as: {code:java} sometext {code} h3. Workaround * This bug doesn't appear in the new editor. Customers impacted by this bug should use the new editor, which is currently being rolled out to all customers.
fields.summary: Code Block macro: wrong formatting shown for ampersand

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Safari users are not able to download document (PDF, DOC) files.

h3. Environment
* Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page with document (PDF or DOC) files
# Try to download any of them

h3. Expected Results
The file should be downloaded

h3. Actual Results
The file is not downloaded. A file with the name "binary" starts downloading but never finishes and the below errors are thrown in the console:
!console.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Use another browser
fields.summary: Not able to download document files in Safari

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
This issue is being closed as the root cause is users showing up as "unknown" after a server -> cloud migration (CONFCLOUD-59989). This happens when the user has a different username or userkey in server than cloud. One of our teams looking into GDPR related work will be looking at solving this by making changes to both confluence server and cloud - progress will be tracked on an internal ticket and reflected on CONFCLOUD-59989.
{panel}
Summary

Unknown Users as the personal spacename after migration/restore of the user base after changing email

Steps to Reproduce

Create a personal space export
Import the personal space to another instance
Import the same users to another instance
When you refresh the page, the space name for those personal space will display as "Unknown Users"

Expected Results

Personal space should be renamed linked to the username

Actual Results

"Unknown user" is shown after the import.

Workaround
 # Delete the previous personal space and remigrate those page to the new personal space
fields.summary: Unknown User as personal space name during import
